newsitem.title: LATVIA: Thomson BankWatch sets ratings for Latvian Parekss.
newsitem.headline: Thomson BankWatch sets ratings for Latvian Parekss.

text.p: Thomson BankWatch said on Friday that it had assigned short-term and long-term debt ratings to Latvia's largest bank, Parekss Bank.
The rating agency said in a statement that it assigned Parekss an LC-2 for its short-term local currency debt and and a senior debt rating of BB+.
"As one of Latvia's most significant banks, Parekss continues to benefit from the flight to quality and has diversified into a more universal bank," the statement said.
"The number of borrowers grew by three fold during 1996 and by end-1996 its market share of loans was the highest (in Latvia) at 27 percent," Thomson said.
"Asset quality is satisfactory...capital is considered strong and Parekss continues to have the highest returns (in Latvia)," the statement said.

"The ratings reflect Parekss' overall satisfactory financial condition and its position in the Latvian market. The long-term senior debt rating is equivalent to BankWatch's sovereign ceiling," it added.
Thomson has been active in the Baltic region and has assigned ratings to Lithuania's leading private commercial banks, Vilniaus Bank and Hermis Bank.
The banking sectors in both countries have recovered from serious crises.
Thomson also said recently that it planned to assign ratings to Estonia's top banks.
